activities: ICON Laboratories Inc., its subsidiaries and affiliates provide a broad range of outsourcing services to the pharmaceutical and biotechnology industries on a global basis. During the conduct of its operations, ICON may collect and process data relating to study participants, clinical research investigators and their staff, medical and healthcare professionals, customers, vendors, contractors, consultants, in addition to human resources data. Due to the global nature of its business, ICON may transfer personal data between members of the European Union and the United States.
corpofftitle1: Executive Vice President, ICON Laboratories Inc.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: personnel, client, vendor and third parties, clinical trial subject data
recoursemech: EU Data Protection Authorities ans Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner.
